channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Various potholes, 6th February
item.description:
Whittington Road,Benhall is in a very very poor condition anywhere from the Gloucester Road t junction through and past Stanway Road and Coberley Road. I rep[orted this road some time last year or maybe in 2023 and small repairs were done..but now the road is even in more poor condition. VERY dangerous for not onle car owners but also to CYCLISTS
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole by traffic lights, 6th February
item.description:
Pothole very close to the traffic lights
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Pool Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes and road disintegrating in many places., 6th February
item.description:
Numerous potholes getting bigger Road disintegrating at the sides which is VERY dangerous for cars pulling into the side to AVOID the potholes. Witht the road disintegrating at the sides this is also VERY dangerous for cyclists and walkers Also the area at the top of the road near to Grovefield Way is also in a terrible condition with an aarea still just covered with sandbags and a cone with NOTHING being done to it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working, 5th February
item.description:
Street light not working on Highland Road near the rear entrance to 9 Parkland Road. In fact all street lights are out in Littledown road, Parkland Road and Highland road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Highland Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Really messy mud left by highways, 5th February
item.description:
I keep trying to resolve a problem that you yourselves have identified but Highways have just dumped mud in the hole. I have sent several messages and I am unable to have a conversation about it. This is thoroughly unsatisfactory and will just create massive amounts of mess as you can see from the photo. The hole will return within days. I will call to complain about poor resolution. All you need to do is widen the drop kerb or tarmac the pavement. Your resolution is a plaster that will never work. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Beeches Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on left hand side of the road, 5th February
item.description:
Large unmarked pothole on left side of birdlip hill road - heading towards Birdlip from Brockworth. Unfortunately going over this resulted in immediate puncture to passenger side front tyre.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes between car park and the Stables, 5th February
item.description:
There are multiple potholes on a 20m stretch of daisybank road between the following locations ///supporter.zaps.equality And ///expose.chaos.posed I hope itâ€™s ok to report these (about 10 in total) rather than report separately. They are very close to 75mm deep so need addressing. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daisybank Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement has worn away and is now a hole and a muddy mess, 5th February
item.description:
Outside 289 Gloucester Road. Been getting progressively worse for a couple of years. Mainly due to people pulling up and parking to avoid the bus stop when delivering parcels etc.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 287a, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Marking missing across drive, 5th February
item.description:
Outside number 8 & 10 Kingsmead Road, both pavements are lowered for our driveways, but we keep getting people (Baylis workers) parking across our drives for the majority of the day. There is no marking on the road not to park there, just the lowered pavements. Please can a white line be painted across our driveways to hopefully prevent this happening in the future

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

cars parking on verges causing damage and massive muddy sections on footpath where children walk to school

item.title: Danger, 5th February
item.description:
Photos were taken today 5th February, 3 minutes before children leave High School Leckhampton! No footpath access at all! The lorry has been causing the obstruction since 14.45! Action needs to be taken against Miller Homes (the developers).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
